intro: Noccaea leblebicii, commonly known as the Turkish spring beauty, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Turkey. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants, and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are basal, rosette-like, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are usually white or pale purple. Noccaea leblebicii is an ephemeral plant, blooming briefly during the spring before going dormant.
